intro: Sedum aristatum, commonly known as the noble sedum, is a species of flowering plant in the family Crassulaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Europe, including the Alps and the Carpathians. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, star-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Sedum aristatum is often cultivated in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its hardy nature and attractive appearance.
